summary: Jerome A. Cullings was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). He appears in multiple payroll and certification reports from 1977 and 1978. These documents list his name, position, and salary during the specified accounting periods. The documents indicate that he was employed by the HSCA for at least a year, from October 1977 to November 1978.
significance: Jerome A. Cullings' significance lies in his employment with the HSCA, the committee tasked with investigating the assassination of JFK. While the documents do not specify his exact role within the committee, his presence on payroll and certification reports indicates he was a staff member involved in the HSCA's operations.
